Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Health

Items.Title: Oversight - Detecting, Preventing, and Responding to Public Health Emergencies in NYC.
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Detecting, Preventing, and Responding to Public Health Emergencies in NYC.

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Health
Resolution Declaring the Month of March as Blood Clot Awareness Month in the City of New York.
Items.MatterName: Declaring the Month of March as Blood Clot Awareness Month in the City of New York.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the federal government to make over-the-counter naloxone free for everyone.
Items.MatterName: Federal government to make over-the-counter naloxone free for everyone.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, Senate Bill S.9901, creating a state licensure program for CDPAP fiscal intermediaries.
Items.MatterName: Creating a state licensure program for CDPAP fiscal intermediaries (S.9901).

Items.Title: Resolution to urge the federal government to continue its scientific, forward-thinking advocacy and commitment to protecting American public health
Items.MatterName: Urge the federal government to continue its scientific, forward-thinking advocacy and commitment to protecting American public health.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.9906/A.10692, legislation that would eliminate deductibles, copayment, coinsurance, or any other cost-sharing requirements for asthma inhalers
Items.MatterName: Eliminate deductibles, copayment, coinsurance, or any other cost-sharing requirements for asthma inhalers (S.9906/A.10692).

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign, H.R. 2665, the Supporting Safety Net Hospitals Act, to delay Medicaid disproportionate share hospital payment reductions until Fiscal Year 2026

Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly to pass, the New York State Senate to introduce and pass companion legislation, and the Governor to sign, A.2705, relating to the amount of state aid reimbursement for public health services by a municipality in the city of New York when the municipality is providing some or all of certain identified core public health services.
Items.MatterName: Amount of state aid reimbursement for public health services by a municipality in the city of New York when the municipality is providing some or all of certain identified core public health services (A. 2705).
